description:
This small Northern style Vietnamese pho restaurant serves some of the cleanest pho broth and noodles I have ever had. 

The chicken pho here is really good and definitely sticks out compared to other places. 

It's a great go to if you are craving some noodle soup.
author: Jonathan C.

description:
So i like this chicken pho, its a great hang over cure. Except its super salty. And i always dip helllla fish sauce with my jalapenos.. so thats probably not good...

I usually come here for the Pho Ga, buttered tofu, and lemon beef carpaccio. 
Pho Ga is salty, but the chicken and noodles are both super satisfying in my tummy. 
Buttered tofu is similar to salt and pepper tofu except they use the extra silky / smooth tofu to deep fry. 
Lemon beef carpaccio is good, but their sweet fish sauce is just not as flavorful as i'd like...but, the slices of beef they use are premium. 

I dont come here for service, i know its an asian establishment. I expect to grab their attentiom, place my order, and my order to arrive fairly decently. 
But almost everytime i've been there, theres either a peice of hair or fly somewhere in my food....at least the place is cheap.. but cash only...
author: Amiee C.

description:
Rude service! Have you ever eat a bowl of cold soup pho? Yes I have, in this restaurant. I came to this Vietnamese restaurant many times it's because close to my house. I know long time that guy super rude so whenever i craving for Vietnamese food I will call them order Togo. 
This time I tried dine in. Around 2weeks ago I went there, dine in, ordered crab noodle soup. Ok, crab noodle soup ready to served, put on the sticky table. The soup not boil, not even hot. The temperature level is like warm to cold! And bring a plate of cabbage, peppers,half lime for us put in soup noodle. I put all the cabbage,peppers in my soup noodle, mix them and take a sip the soup! After put them all in, it turn to a bowl of cold soup noodle . So I asked the waiter(the short guy, see him all time there) asked him politely "can you help me heat up my noodle because its cold". He replied, you put everything in thats why it become cold! He then ignored me &walked away. I wonder, is that plate he gave me just for display, not for my soup noodle! He deserve zero star for his bad attitude, bad service! 

Now whenever craving for a bowl of hot delicious crab soup noodle I will go to their brother restaurant located in San Bruno, same owner but diff location. I been there few times now, still have not yet disappointed me, bring to me always hot and yummy. After put peppers in a boiled soup even more perfect, bring a little spicy to my soup.
author: Epicure M.

description:
Recently when I crave for pho in the sunset, this restaurant comes to mind.

The broth is generally clear and good. Their noodles, oh my god, is so smooth. I like their noodles more than the shorter width ones found at any other vietnamese restaurant. They don't give you any bean sprouts with your pho though, only the jalapeno slices and lime wedges. 

This is a good spot for pho. Not the best bargain out there ($9.75 after tax for a small) or the fastest service but their bowl of pho got me wanting to finish everything, including the noodles.
author: Amy T.

description:
Their chicken pho is arguably the best in SF. I've been here many times and I always order #7. I like their appetizers as well such as the fried tofu. 
Two nights ago though my experience led me to think the place isn't as well kept as I thought due to dirty spoons and plates. The broth in my pho was also a little too salty. Chicken proportions were smaller than before. I mean don't get me wrong. This place is good. I'm just hoping they are consistent in their meals, cleanliness, and proportions. I'd still come here if I ever craved for chicken pho.
author: Debby N.

description: 3.5 Star....This place used to be good when first open. I haven't been here for years so now is a good chance to check it out. They are known for their chicken noodle soup which I thought it was ok. The pho dac biet ( beef noodle soup )and bun Rieu ( crab noodle soup) was ok too. I was surprised that the meat looking so thick in the bo tai chanh ( beef carpaccio) was actually soft and good. The noodles they use for the pho n ga pho was also pretty good.  the lady was really nice and helpful especially with two young kids. I prob would come back only if I'm in the area and craving bo tai chanh.
author: Christy V.

description:
Not going to lie, this place has one of the best pho ga you can find in NorCal.

I love the noodles they use in the pho ga. The broth is good but can be salty depending on your taste.

Service can be better, but you came here to eat, not to be pampered. 

Come through if you want legit chicken pho. It helps that this is located on the side of SF that isn't so busy. Parking isn't that bad at all!
author: Vuong P.

description: This is my go-to pho place. Really rich beef broth and the first chicken pho that I like! Not a big fan of other dishes in there but I have been here for over 5 times and still craving for it every week!
author: Rosita O.

description:
Food quality and customer service.  Keeping Your Restaurant Biz Afloat 101

This was my go-to pho place for many years. Over the years, I brought friends and family just for their chicken pho.  Sadly, today would be my very last time to come here because of rude service.  

They used to have the best Pho Ga, but ridiculously rude service (the older lady).   So, it was good + bad.  Fast forwarded a few years today.  MSG salty water-downed soup base Pho Ga and the ridiculously rude service (same older lady).  So, it is bad + bad.

In business schools,  they said consistency is key to success in business.  Yup, the pattern (bitc*h face attitude+minimal customer service+entitlement to big tips) is still there.  Yup, this place still got one of the two key elements consisting.

Well, goodbye, tam biet, addio, sayōnara, zàijiàn, adiós!
author: Toasty H.

description: Came in at 8:15pm on a Tuesday. They declined serving us and said they're closed even when the sign said closing hour is at 9:30pm. Would not even rate them 1 star but they didn't even say sorry so here is it
author: Linh Khanh D.

description: Nothing spectacular, but if you want Vietnamese food there's doesn't appear to be other options in Noriega. The tables here were sticky even after they wiped it down. The chicken noodle soup large came in a big portion, but the soup had too much MSG.  Their fish cake appetizers is served traditional style with some vegetables and a heap of cold rice noodles. The coffee is something you can skip.
author: Eric T.

description: 9.5/10 best pho ever, just 0.5 off since it's a bit salty to my sensitive palate. I got the chicken pho and it's some of the best flavorful chicken ever. My gf got the duck pho and it came on a separate plate, very clean taste and healthy feeling! Best pho in the Bay Area
author: Wats S.

description:
BEST CHICKEN PHO in the city with option of thicker rice noodles (hu tieu). Seriously does not get better than hu tieu noodles with your chicken pho.

Fried Tofu & Imperial Rolls are pretty good here as well, although I think I like the tofu more.

Another highlight is their Bun Rieu. Added plus that you can substitute vermicelli noodles with hu tieu.

Love their homemade chili sauce. Watch out, it's pretty spicy!

Remember it's cash only, & you're there for the delicious chicken pho not the service!
author: Carol N.

description: The best Chicken Pho in town... plus their homemade hot sauce... Two Thumbs Up! The only drawback is cash only! Too bad Yelp doesnt have a half star rating! My favorite is the chicken + intestines pho... and i always ask for chicken liver only... Compared to turtle tower and other chicken pho vendors in town, this place is one of the top available in the city... When i think chicken pho, this is my first choice to go!!
author: Dedy G.

description:
Northern Style pho ga (chicken pho).
Meh pho.
Meh service.
Super salty. Too little meat (we ordered a small and a large).

Saving grace was their orange colored hot sauce at the table. I dunno if it's made in-house, but it was a unique flavor and truly hot (habanero?). I am insane about extreme spicy and so if there's a good spicy sauce I'd prly give 3 stars even if the rest of the food was bad. It wasn't bad... just mediocre pho and a rly spicy sauce.
author: Conscious C.

description:
Come here for the pho ga (chicken pho).  There are two factors that makes this place better than the rest, the cook of the noodles and the chicken.  The broth is exactly the same as most places, in fact it's not better than Pho Ga Huong Que Cafe in Oakland.  But again, those two factors alone makes a well worth visit.  They are also generous with their chicken when others are more stingy.  Service is typical.

Food 5
Service 3
Overall 4
author: Patrick C.

description:
I've tried several dishes here including the pho ga, pho ga with intensine, bun rieu, curry chicken soup and a regular beef pho.

Every dish came with a plentiful amount of noodles and meat!  And the broth definitely warms you up on a cold windy day. 

This place only has the flat rice noodles or a vermicelli type noodle. The pho ga is almost comparable to the one at turtle tower, lots of juicy chicken and onions! 

The bun rieu with the crab paste is super flavorful. Some places make their bun rieu either too watery or too salty but this place has the right amount of flavor in it- just like my moms cooking!

The curry chicken soup comes with a thicker type broth with lots of chicken! But this one comes with chicken and bones - so if you don't like to pick out the bones then I don't suggest you get this dish and go with the regular pho ga - or request no bones?  I'm not sure if they will do that for you though, but worth a try.

Their regular beef pho comes with just enough meat and noodles to make you full after your meal and is very tasty.
author: Sherry L.

description:
Their Bun Bieu is the best pho I have ever had. I'm a regular there. Staff is very nice and have even remembered what my group always has! 
I strongly recommend.
author: Svetoslav P.

description:
Chicken pho? I can't believe I've never had it before! I live so close to here and it took my friends from out of town to show me this gem! 

6 of us showed up on a Sunday at 5pm and was promptly seated at a big table. We didn't even have to look at the menu (although, I did to see what else there is) and my friend basically told the waitress, 6 chicken pho's regular size. WOW. 

It came so quickly and we were enjoying our noodle soups before I could take a few sips of my tea. It was delicious and surprisingly different than what I was expecting. The meat was less than I imagined and they didn't give the condiments I was expecting (bean sprouts, jalapenos and lime)...we had to ask for it. They only brought onions to the table and 1 lime wedge for 4 of us. 

For the price and dish, it was definitely worth it. I believe it was $7.95 a bowl and it was the perfect amount for one person. 

Parking: We found a spot a block away and it was nice to take that walk after stuffing our faces with delicious pho!
author: Jennifer K.

description:
What you should be coming here for is the curry chicken pho with fat noodles. This stuff sells out if you come to late. I've tried different curry pho and this so far has me coming back. I come here so often the owner knows my order. As for the that ridiculous house made fireball sauce. The owner makes it and I was told there is like 2 or 3 tea spoons of ghost powder in it. I asked the owner if I could buy some, but it's not for sale. Won't even tell me how he makes it. Fair enough..

My typical order is as follows. 

1. Curry chicken pho with fat noodles
2. Imperial rolls with extra lettuce. They way you are suppose to eat it is to wrap the imperial roll with the lettuce and add some of the pickled veggies. Boom.. You get a hot cold crisp sensation. 
3. Vietnamese coffee
author: mrhustler h.

description:
I'm not Vietnamese but have been eating pho for sometime. And man was I disappointed. 

I have a cold and happened to be in the area, looked it up on Yelp figures why not. 

I ordered the rare beef beef ball. 

I never had pho with thick noodles but I said never mind let's try. 

One spoon full of broth and I swear I felt like I just ate a teaspoon of salt. 

The soup was stupid salty!!

The beef small pieces and I really swear it was old!!!

I'm glad I didn't get sick!! And never again will go there!!

This is not even a real Vietnamese Pho joint. I should have drives few more miles to go to an actual pho place
author: Shakeel T.

description: Literally my favorite place to get pho!!!!!! I come here so often, I don't think I can ever get tired of this place. Pho ga, BOMB! Rare beef pho, the most tenderest beef even after marinading in the broth! Curry pho ga, so flavorful!
author: Marilyn P.

description: I LOVE THIS PLACE!! I live nearby and I eat here alllll the time. This place is my favorite spot for chicken pho. I love how chewy the noodles are and I like how they give flat rice noodles instead of small rice noodles like most pho places. Their butter tofu is really good and I like how they serve it with pickled radish. The bun rieu is alright, I thought it was too salty. The only thing I don't like about coming here is the cash only policy.
author: Katie L.

description:
This place has decent Pho. One of the smallest owned restaurants in the Sunset Avenue. 

We came in, waited for our table and was told to sit down. Not to mention the table was half way clean, meaning all the dishes were taken away but the table was not wiped down left with napkin and debris. 

One of the waiters (male, short hair, I think he's the owner) came to take our order. We asked for him to clean the table. He made a stupidest comment, "you should have not sat down, the table is dirty". I was like "uh, we were told to sit down, what was it that you wanted us to do?" He kept quiet. Asked us "what do you want to order"? I was just about to tell him what I wanted to order (literally 3 seconds), he then said "uh, not ready, come back!" 

What kind of customer service is this? Why do these people feel like because they are busy, they have the right to mistreat their customers? 

‍ overall the food was mediocre. Not bad not good, decent enough for the price and taste for a quick meal when you don't have a lot of time to spare.
author: Lani U.

description: If you're going to eat here, stick with the pho. The five spice chicken rice plate was very disappointing. There was hardly any spice if you are to ask me. It was dry, overcooked, and flavorless. I basically had to drink the fish sauce with it for it to be edible. The chicken was served atop a huge mound of rice. Will never come here again for the rice platters! Service is quick making turnover quick. You might even have to share a table with other customers if your party is small, which is typical of smaller Asian restaurants.
author: Amy T.

description:
I'm torn. I feel like I might give it a 4? It's really standard pho. I'm not blown away but I'm always satisfied. I feel like it's how it's supposed to be, but that there is nothing above and beyond.

Broth is solid. The last time I went the beef was particularly tender and delicious.  The chicken is also nice and tender.

As with every pho place I've been the portions are huge.  I always get a small and it's plenty.

Sometimes they don't bring out bean sprouts and basil to go with it - so that's a problem.  

I've never had trouble getting a table, but I think I always come on random week nights. I've seen a waiting list sitting at the door, so I think they do get busy - but they are fast (as pho tends to be) so it probably moves pretty quickly.

They bring you hot "tea" when you arrive - which is really mostly hot water, but I kinda love it.

Got the shrimp spring rolls last time and they were solid.  

CASH ONLY
author: Sarah C.

description: I ordered shrimp rolls and when I bit into one there was a a piece of a latex glove in it--the fingertip part. How do you not notice when you have a hole in your glove when you're preparing food?? That's disgusting.
author: Kat L.

description: Update: Gave this place another shot and customer service has improved ten-fold. I noticed the grouchy older lady no longer works there so maybe that is why. As long as the food and service is good I will now continue to come here mainly for the chicken pho.
author: Donna M.

description: Ladybug noodle soup! Half way done... made me so full. One of the waitresses was so rude, kept yelling at my mom and I, and told her coworker in another language that I understand: "anybody can come here? Their English is terrible."  And when my mom wanted to take a photo of the ladybug, the lady tried to push away my mom's arm, and put all the small dishes in the soup, hold the bowl and yelled at us that 'if you think there's a bug and refuse to pay, get out of here! I cover you! It's on house! Get out! Leave! Right now!'I was amused they way she twisted the whole thing.  We asked her to check the bug, and asked for the bill...  I've been living in this neighborhood for a decade, eating out 5 times a week, had never experienced
author: Tee T.

description:
My friends and I come quite often, simple, fast, and delicious. I usually always the the pho ga (chicken) here because the taste is so pure. It's very clean and there's so much flavor in it. 

I've also tried the curry pho and it is good too, but I think I like pho ga better. This isn't your typical pho place so don't ask for the bean sprouts, mint, basil, etc. They won't have it and you won't need it. 

I'll be back very soon again
author: Jonathan W.

description:
I just found the best chicken pho in the city. The broth isn't too salty, the chicken isn't dry, and the serving is pretty generous. For $8-9 I will definitely be back for their chicken noodle soup. 

I also got to try the bun rieu and though a solid bowl, the pho ga was the star of the meal. I've had better bun rieu elsewhere as I prefer a thicker broth. This one was a thinner and clearer broth than I'm used to. So if I had to choose one bowl I'd go for the chicken soup. 

However the service is slow. As mentioned in other reviews, the customer service is meh and you have to ask multiple times for what you want before getting it, ex the check. But if you enter the restaurant not in a rush and mentally prepared for slow service, then this place will be alright for you
author: Carissa G.

description:
this place is still nasty. i came here because my friend was hungry. i told him no, but that's the only soup place around! the people are still all rude, they splashed soup on my clothes, the lady didn't even give me my food, she just put it on the table. don't me and yourself a favor! never come here again!

Honest review!! 
-Poison Ivy
author: Poison I.

description: My all time favorite place for pho! I got the chicken pho and their noodles texture was smooth, the soup was flavorful, and the chicken was tender! Their imperial rolls were yummy as well and even came with a side of vermicelli noodles and salad. Got our food within 5 minutes and was happy with the service we got. Lots of street parking here too.
author: Victoria T.

description: Chicken Pho is the must have here. Highly recommended the curry chicken pho as well. The curry broth is creamy with strong flavor of curry, not spicy at all. They always serve food fast and the prices are reasonable.
author: Joyce C.

description:
After a night of drinking, my group of friends and I ended up here for the hangover remedy. I ordered #10 regular ($7.50) with well done and rare beef noodle soup. Nothing bad, nothing too special --your typical bowl of pho. They serve the pho Northern style, so no beansprouts and the noodles are a thick kind. Not exactly my preference for pho, but the broth got the job done and it was the only thing I finished.

Take note that this place is CASH ONLY too.
author: Cindy Z.

description: Great location and best hungover chicken noodle soup. Lunch hours and weekends are usually packed but if you order to go, you can easily split it into two meals. Top 3 of my choices are 1. Chicken noodle 2. Chicken with offals noodle 3. Satay noodles and you can always add a sunny side up egg on the side. Known for their chicken noodle here, make sure to check it out if you're hungover!
author: G L.

description: Don't leave ur food on the table while u use the restroom, or ur overly salty Pho will disappear.
author: Steve J.

description:
Small #9 for me please! 

This is one of my favorite pho places because I love that their beef slices are not super dry or rough.

What I ordered: 
#9 - Raw Beef Noodle Soup
#16 - Curry Chicken Noodle Soup

I especially hate the feeling when your raw beef is in the broth and it gets harder and doesn't taste tender anymore, thank god they aren't like that here. Their service is super speedy, I never felt like I had to wait a long time. Be careful when you eat the chicken pho because it's not deboned. (you have hands, you can debone it yourself, don't complain)

Remember, they are cash only! So, come prepared.
author: Eva O.

description: i used to go to turtle tower before coming here and i feel like i like this place just a little bit more than turtle tower! i only get the chicken pho here and it's soooo flavorful and good. sometimes it's a little salty but i still enjoy it. there's so much chicken in my bowl all the time and i always have leftovers! this is a good place to go to if you are hungover too haha it cures it! i haven't tried anything else here because i just always need to get the chicken pho whenever i go!
author: diane d.

description: Love this place, their food is sooooo good. I like their pho best, but their curry chicken noodle and butter tofu are delicious too. This place is tiny so there's not much to expect but good Vietnamese food, always satisfy my craving.
author: Hong D.

description: I'm gonna admit I'm one of those people who really only eat pho on Sunday mornings after a night of drinking. So all these reviews about the soup being full of msg and super salty I can totally agree with, but I also enjoy it. It's probably also a good disclaimer to note that I only come here for one thing and one thing only, the chicken noodle soup and I think it's delicious. I enjoy that they use lots of green onion, thick fresh rice noodles and a good amount of dark and white chicken meat. The only downside is this place is cash only. It's a pain in the butt to walk across the street for the atm, but I still do it cause the noodle soup is worth it.
author: Alice Z.

description:
My heart takes me to Quan Ngon when I crave Hanoi pho, but my mind tells me I deserve more.

Like a pyramid scheme, my aunt introduced me to this place and I introduced more people here. Although Quan Ngon always satisfied my pho craving, it also gave me more MSG than I could handle in a short time. The water was always hot, so there's nothing I could do to quench my thirst. I downed the scalding hot water and asked for more, but eventually, I left swearing off salt for the day.

And yet I'll still come back. If you're in the area and crave for Northern style pho, it's the place to go.
author: Chii L.

description:
Parking can be tough around here, depending on the day and time you come. It usually is pretty busy, so you may be better off ordering takeout. It's one of the few pho places located in the "middle" of the sunset district. 

PRICE wise, it's decent, $8-9 but QUALITY wise, it's nothing special. The broth seems like there's possibly some MSG, but I'm not 100% sure. The pho bowls aren't even made with rice noodles - so it's not "real pho". I rather go to Kevin's or Yummy Yummy (noodles on fleek here). It's just convenient if you're around this area and really want pho. I find that many people seem to eat pho for the broth, but I actually prefer to focus on the noodles, but maybe that's just me - hence noodles matter a lot to me when rating a pho place. 

SERVICE is usually the typical in and out Vietnamese place - fairly quick.
author: Cheri C.

description:
This is one of my favorite pho restaurants, I recommend this to those in the Sunset area looking for some Vietnamese food. I have been a customer since 2010, and the quality of the food still fulfills my expectations. My favorite here is the pho ga, it is tasty and worth the price in my opinion. The soup is full of flavor and the noodles are silky, the combination is wonderful. In addition to the noodle and soup, the chicken is a great balance of texture. 

The environment is pretty chill and the waiters are decent. You can come alone or with a group of friends, great place to talk and relax. I always came here in the past and I still continue to this day. Although their other dishes are great I'd say the chicken pho is their best!
author: Benjamin C.

description:
Coming from a Vietnamese person, this place is pretty bad. If you live in the immediate area, it could serve as a quick fix but I'd rather drive to Turtle Tower. 

Also, this isn't authentic pho at all. The staff spoke to me in Cantonese and were surprised when I responded in Vietnamese. They're selling what appears to be Northern-inspired pho (no bean sprouts, wide noodles), but Turtle Tower does a wayy better job and is authentic. Northern style (aka "Hanoi style") pho is supposed to have tenderized rare steak, which I didn't find in my bowl. The broth was lackluster and left me unsatisfied with my cravings. 

To top it off, I got a really bad stomach ache shortly thereafter which I assume was due to the unhygienic environment. If you want real pho, you should look elsewhere like Kevin's noodle house for Southern style, or Turtle Tower.
author: Rick L.

description: Used to come here pretty often but the service has gotten rude. Food is ok. Curry soup noodle was pretty good.
author: Sky F.

description: It was alright. I really liked the noodles from the chicken pho and I think this is their best dish. The service is meh and they're a bit rude. I went in and ordered in Vietnamese only to find out the owner is chinese. If you open a Vietnamese like damn at least have one Vietnamese speaker. I had to tell a Vietnamese family who was about to order that they didn't speak Vietnamese...anyways I prefer My Canh or Turtle Tower
author: Tracy T.

description: I saw the cook smoking cigarettes in the kitchen with his gloves on, and I saw the waiter combine a bunch of half-drunk iced coffees into one cup to serve to someone else. That's definitely not up to code.
author: L M.

description:
If I'm not feelin' Kevin's noodle house, I like to switch it up and come here instead. 

Parking - it's not bad. There is tons of metered and residential parking. 

Service - ehh it's okay. Kinda spotty sometimes. 

Food - I always order the small tai bo vien and it def fills me up! I really like that they use the wider rice noodle compared to other places. Really good consistency too! Usually these type of noodles can easily be over cooked but this place has it down I would say. The broth is a little oily though...but there is still a ton of flavor. 

Definitely will be back!
author: Coco L.

description:
To be honest, Freaking salty and freaking service.
We ordered 2 number 8 and we had to wait more than 30 mins and the waiters didn't bother to ask us about our food. Very disappointed.
author: Hoai N.

description: This is my go to chicken pho place when I don't want to drive all the way to Turtle Tower. They serve the chicken pho with the fat noodles. It is definitely no Turtle Tower and you can tell they put a ton of MSG in the broth but in a pinch or if I'm in the neighborhood, it will do.
author: Ang W.

description: More than 30 minutes wait for a pho after order. Never happen in other pho restaurants. For people only have 1 hour lunch time. Do Not Come! 30 mins wait for a bowl of pho!
author: N V.

description:
Seems to be really famous for chicken pho and maybe that's what I should have had but decided to go with the beef meatball and rare beef instead. It was just alright. The broth was maybe a 3 out of 10. It tasted kind of like bamboo shoots for some odd reason. The best part was probably the noodles. Whatever noodles they used, I liked 'em. I also had the shrimp spring roll. Good portion but was also just alright. Think it would have been better with mint leaves inside the roll.

Left me wanting something else so will probably not return.
author: Hello E.

description: Tasty, quick, fast, and easy. Just how I like it! Has all the standards for Hanoi style pho. The house chili sauce is hella bomb.
author: Al K.

description:
Please don't come here! Horrible foods and cash only even your bill 100usd 
I will never comeback and I will tell my friends same!
author: Tram N.

description: Other day i Walked in at 803 but on here it says it's closed at 930.. told me they were closed. ?Change your timing if your closing at 8pm. Won't come here again.
author: Jerah R.

description: Love love love this place .. amazing pho ga.. I'm a regular here. Amazing soup fast service cash only ... be sure to try to beat the dinner rushes some of the popular soups sell out quick
author: Frances L.

description:
My go-to spot whenever I'm back home. I always get the pho ga with intestines. It serves as the ideal upset stomach or hang over food. The noodles are thicker than your typical pho noodles, more like Chinese style hoa fun noodles, which is a rare find but tastes so much better. The mixture of intestines are gamey and crunchy, but works well with the tender chicken in the soup.

Today I tried the bun rieu, it was pretty good! The broth was not over powering with tomato taste, it was just right. They are very generous with the amount of noodles given but stingy on the crab balls. Nonetheless, I was stuffed after eating my size small bowl.

Don't forget to try the imperial rolls!
author: Christina L.

description:
The bun rieu is fantastic - savory and umami-rich with the tomato and side of shrimp paste. I always think I'm going to order the bun rieu here..but, lately, I've wanted comfort food and will order the pho ga instead. The broth is flavorful and clean tasting - though I do wish the broth would be served even a few degrees hotter. Though it is served in the northern style (without the bean sprouts, Thai basil, jalapeno, and citrus of the southern style), Sriracha and hoisin sauces are available on the tables if you want that option.  Only downside is on a few occasions, they have run out of beef or the bun rieu. The key is not to arrive too late!

Miscellaneous: Many compare this restaurant to Turtle Tower. I love Turtle Tower but seem to visit this restaurant more due to easier parking and hours of operation. Don't forget, it's cash only! Parking is on the street, but it's also residential and fairly easy once off Noriega.
author: Diann L.

description:
I'm so very disappointed that I have to write this review but it has to be done unless something changes.. 

I really enjoy the food here from pho to rice dishes and the food we received tonight was no different but this review is in regards to the customer service. 

I understand that there is a language barrier but regardless of that, I try to be as patient as I can when ordering from here. However, having someone else place an order in their native language and receive an incorrect order is unacceptable. 

The bf called and asked for 2 orders of pho and a BBQ pork rice dish with eggroll (#25). The lady repeated the order in Chinese and he acknowledged it. When the order was picked up and brought home, the pho was there but instead of the rice dish, we got spring rolls. What sucked the most? This dish was for me. 

The bf called back and and explained the mishap.... I really wanted that rice dish but she pretty much said there's nothing they can do and hung up on him. Since I believe this was a discrepancy on their end, I felt they should have honored that so I called them back. 

The same lady answered and I tried explaining the issue but it did not seem like she could understand me as she kept responding in Chinese. I repeatedly asked if she speaks or understands English, saying I don't understand her and what the issue was. Trying to hold my temper i was finally able to compose myself and ask if I can speak to someone else who may understand me. The usual guy answered and I felt like a dick for asking if he could understand me and so explained the issue and asked if we can come back to exchange the incorrect dish with the right one. He said thats fine so we make the trip back, egg rolls unopened in their box, in hand. 

We get there and I hand the guy the box of egg rolls. Less than a minute later, he gets the dish and tells me I owe him another $2something. I told him I don't have any cash and he tells me theres a difference in price all while ignoring the fact the order was placed incorrectly. I felt the need to remind him that the order was placed wrong, was brought home, and our unnecessary trip back to exchange the dish. He told me it was fine and I thanked him and took my food home. 

As I'm really appreciative that we eventually got the correct order, I did not feel it was necessary to brush off the BF saying they can't help us as well as demanding I pay for the difference of the dish after getting the wrong one and having to drive back to exchange it. 

We won't be coming here for a while which SADDENS me but to treat customers that way is not right. We'll come back one day, hopefully with better service.
author: Clarizeyale R.

description: My go-to for chicken pho. Quan Ngon specializes in northern Vietnamese pho, with flatter and broader noodles with speciality in chicken broth.
author: Sid D.

description: Disgusting! The worse pho that I ever had. The beef meatballs were mostly congealed fat (see pic). The broth was very salty and tasted like boxed beef stock. Instead of bringing the usual fresh cilantro and Thai basil that usually accompanies pho, the add dried cilantro bits to the pho. Next, the place has no heat, so you freeze while you are trying to enjoy your meal. EVERYONE was wearing a coat while eating! Finally, it does not look too clean or well kept. I will definitely not be back! If you do go here, be aware that it is cash only.
author: Bayguy C.

description:
3.5 stars

Not a bad experience, but the chicken pho did not have much flavor. The chicken was really tender and delicious though, and the small was a good size. I met up with a friend to catch up and they were nice about letting us stay for over an hour and a half. Didn't give us any pressure to leave. We didn't try anything else, so I can't comment on any of their other dishes, but I think their chicken pho is the most popular. 

I would come back again to give it another shot since my friend said it is one of her favorite places and the pho that day seemed a bit off.
author: Jennifer T.

description: Broh how this place not have a Michelin star man. This the best pho I've ever had. The chicken pho is AMAZING. If you haven't had that, you're missing out on LIFE.
author: Andy H.

description: The place is pretty quaint and comfortable. Service was promptly and friendly. I ordered beef pho... It was awesome. The broth is one of the best in SF, as far as I've seen in my four-year phomance with this city. They served my bowl with large noodles (whatever they're called). All in all this place is slamming and worth checking out
author: Micah B.

description:
I don't know if this is usual or what but today they seem to run out of everything ! They ran out of chicken soup for pho ga but offered to give beef broth , which doesn't really sound that appetizing . They also seem to run out of duck noodles and some appetizers . The menu is already one page but it seemed like it was only half a page long . 

But I'm happy to report , everything we ordered was delicious . We got a bun rieu which was perfectly flavored but it didn't include much crab meat . The pho dac biet came with a ridiculous amount of noodles and soup even though it was a "small" order . The chicken rice plate was also really good .The only small things that didn't make it was the meat in the pho was really thick , so it was just a little chewy and the noodles in the bun thit nuong were ice cold . Usually the noodles should be room temp if they were cooked fresh or recently but they probably grabbed it from the fridge . It didn't taste mushy or old but I would prefer my noodles to not be ice cold . 

Tea was refilled constantly and the waitress was polite but to an extent . Food is good enough where I'll most likely come back .
author: Carmen V.

description: Love this place. The pho broth is delicious and i ask for extra vegetables. I love the five spice chicken cold dish (#34)is also delicious.
author: Ivy D.

description:
My boyfriend and I have been coming to this spot for awhile and we love it. This pho is different compared to other restaurants. The noodles are wider and have no bean sprouts! I'm not a huge fan of bean sprouts so that's a plus. I love the piles of cilantro, green onion, and onions it comes with. And finally, the hot sauce. I don't know where they buy it from or if they make it themselves. It has the right heat to spice up the soup. But be aware, one spoon of it is all your pho needs. It'll stack up. 

The service is good enough. I'm here to eat your food you're serving and cooking for me. I should be the one who needs to show respect and appreciation.

Thanks for the delicious food!
author: Christina L.

description:
1. I love the rare beef with the fish sauce here! 
2. Pork spring rolls are Great when all the ingredients are present (one time it was missing mint? and fish sauce to go)
3. For some reason when i do take out, the soup for my chicken noodle is saltier -_-
4. That's why I like to eat for here, so my chicken noodle soup tastes good and I can ask for fish sauce for my spring rolls.
author: Doby H.

description: I don't know why people are raving about the chicken pho. It was really weird. Made me sick to my stomach picking out the fatty chicken pieces and chicken skin. Also, the server was rude as f*ck. Hard pass on this spot. Hopefully this place doesn't make me sh*t my pants on my bike ride home. 12/10 would not come back.
author: Kyle C.

description:
I decided to give Quan Ngon's Chicken Pho Ga a try one day for lunch.

I ordered a small Pho Ga w/o chicken giblets (#7). Adding the lime(s) and jalapeno(s) are a must! I prefer my noodles with extra lime and extra jalapenos. The broth has a very rich chicken flavor to it and I like that they give dark meat chicken along with white meat. They also have the skin on some pieces, plus or minus depending if you like chicken skin. Their soup isn't very oily, but you can see some oil drops from the chicken. They also use a thicker flat rice noodle than your usual pho rice noodles. Their small size was a perfect amount for me.

I also like their homemade hot sauce, it's got quite a kick.

A small is about $8, definitely worth it.

It's located in outer sunset, so parking is majority street metered parking and can be difficult when it's busy.

There was no line/wait when I went, but the place itself isn't very big so I wouldn't be surprised if there was a small wait.

P.S Cash Only

I definitely want to try their Bun Rieu next time! Out on a mission to find the best!
author: Stephanie L.

description: I come here for occasional chicken pho. Only that.  I've tried the spring rolls, fried egg rolls, and parts of my friends' rice plates. Overall, I'd still stick with the chicken pho. Service is typical of a Vietnamese restaurant- quick but not warm.
author: Corinna T.

description: Fav Pho Ga place...I like it better than Turtle. Pho Ga and that is it.
author: Gary L.

description: I came in to this restaurant and me and my family didn't get greeted, we had to seat ourselves. Instead I saw the waiter in the back standing on the counter trying to kill a fly. Maybe that's why there health rating is a 81/100. ‍ shoes shouldn't be on the counter. Anyways... the food was alright, nothing special. I ordered the large chicken pho and it was okay. The bowl was half empty so it just looked like a regular size pho dumped into a large bowl. Also got the shrimp spring rolls and those were pretty bad. The rice skin was so dry and way to chewy. The peanut sauce had oil pools in it too. Probably not gonna come back anytime soon.
author: Alisa L.

description:
3.5 stars. My friends have been talking about Quan Ngon since the day I moved back to the Bay Area. I finally had a chance to visit and all I can say is... their noodles are amazing. They taste so fresh in the pho and it's probably one of the best-tasting noodles I've had. 

With that said, the service that day was incredibly slow, and the restaurant had this dirty feeling. I was not thrilled about being there... not that I need a five star atmosphere but bad service can really dampen one's experience. I would give this place another try, but needless to say, I was not impressed by anything other than the noodles. Oh and they do not give bean sprouts or jalapeños with the pho.
author: Stefanie C.

description: I wish I can give 0 star to this horrible pho place. Worst service and pho I have ever experienced. The Chinese owner is so rude and he will keep pushing you to finish your meal and go. The pho soup is super salty and it tastes so fake. If you like 100% MSG soup, go to Quan Ngon. I will never come back again!
author: Brian C.

description:
I'm not typically a pho ga kind of man. I enjoy the richer taste of pho dac biet, but after tasting the pho ga here, I don't think I can order anything else. I've never in my life had such rich chicken broth before. I'd like to work here just to learn their secrets. There chicken in the pho was also excellent. It wasn't dried out or rubbery like other places. On top of how great the food was, the prices were incredibly reasonable.

This place does have many of the quarks of a family run restaurant. Although there were several people walking in and out of the kitchen, i think there was only one cook and one server working. The others seemed to just be there to hang out. In between severing, the waiter did lunges and used the counter to do stretches while yelling to some customers in Vietnamese. There's just something really loveable about all that.
author: Rambod B.

description:
From the looks of the food and the name of the restaurant I had the mindset that Quan Ngon was one of those places that was very Vietnamese, but when I walked in all the servers and customers were speaking in Canto. Lol I guess this area of the Sunset is pretty Canto, in the vicinity of ABC Cafe, Mong Kok Dim Sum, and Cheung Hing.

Unlike most Chinese places that have overwhelming menus of endless glossy pages with colorful photos, Quan Ngon featured a simple menu inclusive of all Vietnamese comfort food--pho, rice plates, vermicelli bowls.

[BACKGROUND]

Being sick but being adamant about going on a Yelpventure, chicken pho seemed the most appropriate choice for eating out and I found Quan Ngon via Yelp. (Asian chicken noodle soup? Yes please!) 

[THE NOMS]

The pho was quite on point, with a flavorful balanced broth, not too fatty or salty, and excellent with the noodles. It could have used more chicken and onions, but overall it was satisfying. We ordered both the large and a small chicken pho ($8.50/$7.50), and the larger one was in a bigger bowl but it seems that they just split it more or less evenly into the two bowls. 

And just a warning, the jalapeno toppings are spicy!!! I don't think remove the seeds, and I was too excited about the vitamin C toppings to notice; I ended up literally crying. They serve hot tea without water so I just cried more T-T

We also tried the 5 spice chicken rice plate ($8)--you could hardly taste the 5 spices... so it was more like 0 spice but it was tasty roast chicken nonetheless. The portions were generous: if you want more chicken I would strongly suggest this, as the pho only gives you a few pieces of chicken hidden in the noodle soup.

[THE VERDICT]

Much better pho and 5 spice chicken than anywhere in the Inner Sunset.

[AFTERTHOUGHTS]

Honestly I had my doubts with their iffy health score... but alas, my love for food prevails and it was pho adventure time despite being sick and despite any risks with mediocre health scores. Quan Ngon turned out to look decently clean--there's a bit of the hole-in-the-wall feel, but more in the sense of feeling family-owned feel than being unkempt and dirty. 

Lastly, a tip on parking: the immediate area looks formidably like the Richmond with metered parking and few open spots, but if you go like two blocks down into the residential area it's easy street parking.
author: Edna C.

description: One of the best local pho spots in the Sunset. They are my go to since they are a block away and never disappoint.
author: Marvin A.

description:
I have no idea why I never reviewed this place. I've been here so many times but never got the chance to write a review for this place. This place is DA BOMB!! The wait can be long at times depending on the days but usually you can get seated pretty quickly. My boyfriend and I always come here to get our bun ga (chicken pho but with the vermicelli noodles) and the carpaccio! Carpaccio is so delicious!! The raw beef with the fish sauce and lemon is just superb! I would die for this seriously. Their rice plates are pretty good too! The five spiced chicken?! Nommmm! Seriously, if ya'll never had pho or had a bad experience with eating pho, you should try this place. 
This place is seriously my go to whenever my boyfriend and I feel like eating pho which is like ALWAYS! lol. 
Service is great also. I definitely will be back here soon! :)
author: Monica W.

description:
My friend recommended this place to me. She had a craving for something soupy and suggested we get pho. When your friend tells you, "Their soup is super good and flavorful" and then starts showing you pictures of some of their more popular soups then you know you're gonna wanna go. 

This pho place is located on Noriega, a block away from Osaka Imai for all you foodies out there. Just look for a purple awning. Parking is all on the streets and metered till 6pm and when the hell did a quarter only give you 6 mins? SAN FRANCISCO I AM APPALLED! 

We came here around noon and were able to find parking easy as well as grab a table inside because we beat the rush. Service isn't super friendly but they are speedy to give you menus and take your order. 

I got their noodle soup with rare beef I believe and it was really good! The meat was super tender and the soup had a good amount of flavor in there. They use thicker noodles than the usual one that Pho places use, but I'm not gonna complain. 

CASH ONLY.

They ended up getting busy around the time we were done eating so it took a while to get our check. Eventually I just spoke out loud to get the check instead of waiting for the server to come over. 

Overall, would come back if I was ever in the area for pho.
author: Venus L.

description:
SERVICE: Sucks. Well, ok, it's not terrible...at least not all the time. I have been here a handful of times already but the last time really surprised me. My family and I arrived around 7:30pm. My mom wanted chicken pho in chicken broth. The lady told us there was no more chicken broth. Alright, what about 5-spices chicken over rice? "No more chicken", she says. So, this place is open for another 2 hours and half your menu (prepared with chicken) is gone? This doesn't bother me too much though. What really bothers me is them walking over, waiting until we say something, then telling us they've run out. Then waiting again for us to pick something else before they give us more bad news. That's one thing I appreciate about American restaurants--their need to notify you of menu changes ahead of time. It really makes a difference to some people. 

FOOD: 50% of the time I come to eat here, they run out of what I want. I like to think I'm pretty flexible too. I can generally pick out 2-3 items to order as backups. Like many others, I recommend the Bun Rieu (crab with tomato broth). This is, by far, their most popular item on the menu. If they run out, try their Curry Chicken pho or the classic Rare Steak pho. Contrary to the beef at Kevin's Pho Noodle House on Irving Street, the steak here is actually quite rare and tender when it arrives at your table. 

ATMOSPHERE: None. Kind of dirty. You come here to warm your belly, then go on about your day. Got it? Alright.
author: Greg Y.

description:
I came here with my coworkers for lunch. We got seated at two separate tables because they didn't have enough big tables, which is fine. Food was alright, came quickly though. However, when it came time to pay, they charged us tip even though we had 5 people at the table... WHO DOES THAT. 

Secondly, the older waitress there kept the old receipt from the last time we came, 2 months ago. And that's the reason why they automatically added tips to our bill... not very professional and customer service friendly. Won't be coming back again.
author: Gary G.

description:
If you are someone who doesn't want to drive all the way through Golden Gate Park, fight 19th Ave. traffic and then try to find parking on Geary St., then Quan Ngon is a great alternative! They have my favorite wide noodles that Turtle Tower is known for and the service at Quan Ngon is quick as well! I don't know how I missed this place all these years as I grew up in the Sunset! 

Unfortunately, I didn't take any pictures as I was so excited for my food but I usually get a small Pho Ga (Chicken pho) and prepare a dipping tray with fish sauce and a few slices of jalapeños. This pairs well with the pieces of white meat chicken in your soup! Their small portion is great for a lite lunch or breakfast. 

This place seats around 25 people at most, it's easy to miss as its surrounded by dim sum places and a bunch of other restaurants on Noriega. They haven't ran out of the wide noodles yet for me but it'll be a sad day if it ever happens during my visit.
author: Shelly W.

description:
I always order the chicken pho (What they're basically famous for) whenever I am here! I used to love coming here a few years ago when the store recently opened but nowadays, the quality has decreased a bit. Like a hit or miss. The broth used to be so flavorful with chicken, green onions, and red onions. Most of the times now, it simply tastes salty and less flavored with chicken. Oh, it's also mostly white meat that they give you. A few hours after eating, I also get super thirsty! Not sure if it's because of fish sauce or msg added in the broth? 

I tried the iced coffee here as well, not the type of strong coffee with condensed milk you'd expect from a Vietnamese restaurant. Meh.

As for service, there are usually two people in the front. Pretty quick in getting your order to you!
author: Eva C.

description: Pho ga broth was good, with unique chili sauce at each table (in addition to sriracha and hoisin)...but the noodles were mushy. Cardinal sin at a pho joint.
author: Yaanik D.

description:
Delicious, inexpensive pho ga from restaurant to home in a flash? $8

A chill evening with your sweetheart without washing dishes? Priceless.
author: Janice C.

description: The pho ga is pho-nomenol. The service is really bad. One person waitressing the whole restauraunt. They are understaffed. Expect to wait at least 10 minutes. I would definitely come back
author: Brian C.

description:
Came here with a friend today for lunch, and we ordered the beef carpaccio, bun rieu, and a Vietnamese coffee. 

Beef carpaccio was pretty bad. It was obvious that the meat was frozen, because it was really cold. Also, the meat is cut pretty thick, which I didn't like, and the sauce that came with it had barely any flavor. 

Bun rieu was just okay.. 

Vietnamese coffee was bad. It wasn't strong at all, and it needed more condensed milk. Also, it was literally 90% ice. I probably took like 5 sips and it was gone. 

Service is slow. There was only one waitress when we were there. 

Overall, it was just okay. Would I come back? No.
author: Esther C.

description:
I had a good take-out experience here. Ordered the PHO BO and the VEGETABLE PHO for about $8 each. I found the broth to be more on the vinegar side which was interesting. The meat was delicious and the noodles flat, lots of bean sprouts and lime on the side. 

The place was p-a-c-k-e-d with locals which is a good sign, no? Parking can be tough but I'd go back here!
author: Sebastian F.

description: Great chicken pho! The entire menu does not disappoint. I love coming here as a go-to place. The prices are reasonable for the portions. The service is expected of a traditional Asian restaurant, which I'm used to so no complaints! Don't forget it's cash only :)
author: Kristina L.

description:
I always call this place the "purple place" because I always forget what the name is haha. This is the best hang over cure! Me and my friends always come here when we want something soupy and it's just convenient. I use to go to Turtle Tower to get my Pho Ga (Chicken Noodle Soup) fix, but I come here now because I live in the area and I think it tastes better. I recently tried the Satay Beef Noodle Soup and it is soooo yummy!! The rare beef that comes in the noodle soup is always so tender and delicious. I recommended it to a friend and now she always craves it!

The service here is whatever.. That's probably why their ratings are a little lower. A lot of asian people don't care about good service sadly hahaha.... They're still pretty busy whenever I come. Don't expect anything amazing when coming here, it just does the job when you want your noodle soup fix.
author: Brittany L.

description: Better to dine in than takeout. I ordered a #7 LARGE and the to go container was only 60% filled with soup! Imagine how a small to go order will be.
author: Sophie M.

description: Tasty pho!  I had the duck and dried bamboo pho which had flavorful broth. The duck was served on the side atop a bed of slivered cabbage with a tangy dipping sauce. Perfect meal for after an evening of drinking!
author: Ada C.

description: Somewhere I read that they had great pho. Well definitely not the veggie pho! It was almost tasteless with three pieces of tofu, three slivers of tomato, a drop of lettuce and not great broth. No basil and bean sprouts to put on top either. No other veggies in broth! Only plus was it was hot in temperature and I could add sirachi and hoisin sauce to make it tastier. But no won't be back:((
author: T S.

description:
Pretty mediocre service, but you get what you pay for am I right? I've been here a couple of times and never had a problem with the service. Came on a busy Saturday afternoon and waited over an hour for my food. When I asked the waitress about the wait, she rudely responded with "Other people are waiting for their food too. We have a lot of take out orders." Looked over at the counter and didn't see a single take out order being made, nor did I see people coming to pick up their food. They were just very understaffed.

When the food came, the waiter just placed in randomly on the table, without bothering to ask whose order belonged to whom and just left. What bad service! After we asked for the bill, they literally stopped us from leaving and told us that our bill did not include tip. A tip is reflected upon good service, which was definitely missing from this establishment. The waiters were also talking behind our backs in Chinese, thinking that we couldn't understand them. This was definitely the first time that a waiter had the audacity to ask for a tip, don't get me wrong, I'm not being stingy from tipping. What irritates me the most is that an underserving place is asking for money that reflects quality performance.

TLDR--Do not come here because they will literally flag you down for tips in exchange for poor service.
author: Olivia B.

description: Go to spot for chicken pho! I recently found out that you can get chicken insides like hearts and gizzards added on at no extra charge which is pretty neat. So yummy!! I mainly come here for my chicken pho fix and haven't really tried much of the menu. Tried their spring rolls last time but I'd suggest you skip out on them. Even the lady taking our order recommended a different appetizer and I should have taken that advice. They're just really basic egg rolls, nothing special. There is a slight language barrier but it's not a bid deal; that's what numbers and pictures on the menu are for right? Cash only and parking can be a pain but that's SF for ya.
author: Hayoung K.

description:
I keep coming back for more.  Quality food for reasonable prices.

I usually get the satay beef pho with flat noodles.

It can get crowded, and sometimes they run out of ingredients, but otherwise it is my go to spot for Vietnamese food in the area.
author: Ken H.

description:
1 STAR FOR RUDENESS, NOT THE FOOD!


So I came in on a rainy Thursday, and it appears like there is some form of flooding inside the restaurant. When I walked in they just looked at me with a mug and didn't say anything. Being slightly confused I just decide to sit down and wait until they are free. The woman worker just starts saying "30 minutes" in a rude manner. I just ignore it and decide I'll just sit and wait 30 minutes. Within 1 minute she just comes over and starts saying, "CLOSED CLOSED", with a rude tone and still mean mugging. 1 star for horrible attitude. Could've simply just told us instead of mugging and screaming it at us, lightweight just telling us to GET OUT GET OUT. The guy worker was just standing there mugging. Get your attitude straight you sack of dog diarrhea.
author: Eric A.

description: This place is not good at all!  I ordered pho ga (chicken pho), tasted like the broth was full of msg, the rice noodles were very soggy, thank God the chicken slices were edible.  When I walked in, the restaurant had this horrible smell, I almost left.  The tea was served in a porky smelly plastic glass, hence didn't drink at all, and the service was not friendly at all, the lady who served me didn't say "hi" or "thank you" or smile.   Will not ever go back to this place!
author: Meiko S.

description: I have been eating pho since I was a little girl. Never in my time, I have though I would come across such a badly made pho. Over loaded with much sodium, no flavor none whatsoever. Oh and the chicken was a sorry ass excuse for pho chicken. How on earthy do these people call themselves Vietnamese and Represent their nations food with such lack of respect and careless. No sense of dignity. Wow. You should been ashamed of yourself and calling yourself Vietnamese with no regards what others think of your nations food. I have eaten in other Vietnamese restaurants before, and it was wonderful. Nothing like this Particular establishment. Is my mission to speared the word regarding your sad businesses practices and lack of respect for the food you sell consumers. How dare you think its acceptable to take people's hard earn money and provide such poorly made food. You guys are sorry ass excuse for human beings and too lazy to put any time to prepare a proper food for consumers.
author: Amina A.

description:
Pretty good Pho place on Noriega. I personally like Pho in San Jose better probably because there's more Vietnamese people in my area. This place serves decent Chicken Pho, not too bad actually and it doesn't taste like it's from instant. The noodles are thick and the soup tastes just right. Service is pretty quick and I recommend not going during peak hours as it does tend to have people just standing at the door watching you eat.

Overall my girlfriend's family is in love with this place and I'm just ok. I prefer the Pho in San Jose but then again if I'm in San Francisco I'd come back. Cash only!
author: Alex D.

description:
Got here around 2 and every table was filled to our surprise since it was a Tuesday,  but it only took about 5 minutes of waiting around before we got seated. I ordered the rare beef pho and it was good, nothing really special about it. My friend got the chicken pho and said it was pretty tasty.. so definitely gonna try that next time. As for price, it was a bit pricier than what I'm used to but I guess the quality of the noodles was a bit better. I ordered a large, but only because it was a dollar more than the regular so why not hahah

For the service, it was just alright, water tasted a little like soap, but at least you know they wash their dishes right?!
author: Carrie L.

description:
I don't know why I haven't come here more often!! 

Maybe because I know cheaper pho places around the area, but when I had the craving to try Bun Rieu for the first time, I was recommended this place by my sister. I went with my friend a few days ago and oh man, they make it REALLY good. There was the crab meat, tomatoes, mmmm. Just like how I would have imagined it to be! I would definitely come back here again for it. Maybe even try some of their spring rolls, vermicelli bowls, and pho.

Clean place too. It isn't that big of a restaurant, but it can fit big parties if you come at the right time or call ahead to see how busy it is. When I went, there's a lot of people that come by themselves or in pairs. Even with my friend and I, we had to share a table with someone eating by himself. Service was good. Prices might be on the average side, but I'm sure the dish you're getting is great quality.
author: Kathleen S.

description: The menu is extremely limited there's no choice of brisket, tendon or tripe only rare or well done steak and meatballs. They definitely don't use rice noodles they look like egg noodles. The small comes with a small bowl of a few jalapeños and one slice of lime the broth is nearly flavor less and the noodles are extra weird. Not too clean eo
author: Melanie S.

description:
Pho Ga is just what the doctor ordered for a hangover. Full of flavor and msg goodness without going overboard. 

The prices are affordable and the service is quick which is great since this place can get packed in a hurry. 

I wouldn't recommend the pho tai. bland. tender but low quality beef used.

The imperial rolls are tiny but very tasty. Freshly made with a nice crunch. I would recommend 1 order per 2 people. 

Overall great place to kill a hangover. Best bang for your buck lunch spot too if your in the area.
author: Norris T.

description:
After hearing all the good reviews about their chicken pho here, I had to order it. I've had chicken pho at several pho restaurants in SJ and SF, but there's definitely something special about the Pho Ga they serve at Quan Ngon. Despite the fact that their chicken broth tastes oily and salty.. It's really just the perfect amount of flavor. Their chicken is tender and moist, not dry like the others. Their noodles has the perfect texture, not over-cooked, but just right. Everything in the chicken pho bowl has been made just the way it should be! I'll definitely be coming back here for their Pho Ga :)

A note on their cleanliness... Not the cleanest tables you'll see.

A note on their service... What can you expect from a pho joint?
author: Janica V.

description: Service is quick and the seating goes by fast. We came with 3 parties ahead of us, but we waited less than 8 minutes and got seated. We all had pho which is what this place is best at making. I had the chicken pho - broth was tasty and lots of noodles and chicken. Love the thicker noodles! Generous portion around $8. The total came out to be around $28 for 3 people which isn't bad for lunch :) Parking may be a little harder around here, but there's lots to check out if you do find parking. This place is also cash only.
author: Amanda C.

description:
This is one of my favorite Pho restaurant in the Bay. Pho here is very close to Pho in Vietnam. It's not Americanized. Not only pho but the other noodle dishes are also done very well. I'm not sure how all the workers are Chinese and got all the Vietnamese dishes done better than other Vietnamese owned restaurants around.

One downside is ... yes they don't speak Vietnamese. Another one is that it doesn't look very clean overall. But great food!
author: An L.

description:
One of my favorite vietnamese noodle soup places. My favorite by far is their Duck & bamboo noodle soup. I've never seen this on the menu anywhere so I tried it and fell in love with it. Duck is cold but comes separately on it's own plate. What you do is dip the duck into the sweet tangy sauce and eat with the warm noodle and soup. YUM.

From time to time I get their Chicken pho which is their signature. Really flavorful clean broth. Perfect on a cold day.

I've also tried a few other things on the menu but they are ALL good. My mom got their grilled pork rice plate and normally she gets upset how burned, charred and dry the meat is but they grilled it perfectly. 

Don't expect too much service, it's a small place, get in, enjoy your food, get out.
author: Erica L.

description:
They know how to make chicken pho here. The broth is always flavorful--I've never had a bland, watered-down bowl so they've got consistency down. For $7, you get a nice sized bowl of noodles with a good amount of chicken. It always comes out hot and steamy as any kind of pho should. I used to only eat beef pho, but I think I eat chicken pho more often than regular pho. 

As for service, it's not too bad when they're not packed. Sometimes the water or tea has a little soapy taste, but I'm not here for the water or tea anyways.
author: Doris K.

description:
When I first moved to San Francisco I was on the hunt for great Pho.    I tried three different places before stumbling across Quan Ngon.  Best. Pho. Ever.  Their broth is perfect, not too sweet or fatty, the rare meat is so tender and tastes like butter, and the noodles melt in your mouth.   When I first came here I was disappointed to see the sprouts and basil was not served with the #9 but after tasting it I let that disappointment go pretty quick.  They seem to be accommodating, so they may be willing to give sprouts on the side, but I have yet to ask.

The BBQ pork rolls are amazing.  The first time I had them they were out of  vermicelli noodles and they offered to substitute with sprouts.  It was delicious.  I actually prefer the BBQ pork rolls with sprouts and request it, and they have accommodated with no issues.  

I would have only two small negatives about Quan Ngon.  The first is that they do tend to run out of items - I'm not sure if its because they are so busy or ordering issues.  And the second is sometimes you may not feel warm fuzzies from the staff.  Even with these two negatives this is still hands down my number one go to pho stop.

Quan Ngon has also been noted as one of the best Pho places in the city; http://www.vice.com/read/welcome-to-san-francisco-travel-cityguides.
author: Megan B.

description:
Still love their pho ga. 
Better than Turtle Tower for sure.
author: Heejin L.

description:
Try two things:
1.) Chicken noodle soup
2.) Curry Chicken noodle soup

Service:
Very minimal
author: Moto B.

description: Come in before 9:00 and they tell you they are closed? I don't like being jerked around and I feel like they should honor their store hours. I hope the owners see this and make sure that their employees do their jobs.
author: Ozzie H.

description:
+ THE FOOD
Chicken noodle soup is the way to go! It's SO flavorful and hits the spot. The wide, flat noodles are the best because they're not too chewy and not overcooked. The broth has the perfect taste, but I thought it was a bit too oily. The chicken pieces are pretty tender and there's a good amount of it. I haven't tried their other dishes, but it seems that the chicken noodle soup has really won my heart. 

+/- THE WAIT
This place gets BUSY during lunch hours. The wait can be pretty bad if you have a large group, but if you have just 2 people, then the wait will be 10-15 min max.
author: Cindy C.

description: One of the workers yelled @ me when I asked for water. And when I asked for soy sauce they gave me a pinch of it, literally. Rude af. Go to Yummy Yummy!
author: Stephanie M.

description: While hubby likes their chicken pho, I really wouldn't come back here to get anything. First at all, I think there is no difference between large and small when you get take out. Second, I think their pho is over-priced just because the quality is so similar to few pho places on Irving. Lastly, do not order the combination beef pho! ( all you get is few slices of cooked and uncooked beef and two beef balls) all the other pho places offers beef tripe and tendons and ect. This place do not give you any Brazil leaves and bean sprouts. :,(
author: Elaine Y.

description: Nasty food and bad service with  bad attitude. No good. Chinese owner don't know how to cook pho . The only real Vietnamese cuisine have to be 100% Vietnamese owner.
author: Joseph C.

description:
All I have to say is Omfg.

The Curry Chicken Pho will actually change your life. They have cubes of cut up potato that are soaked in the broth and it is seriously unbelievable.

The only downside is that the chicken pieces are still attached to the bone, so there are small bone fragments floating in the broth. 

Definitely come here for the Curry chicken pho. The first time I came here they were out, and I ended up getting the regular chicken pho, which was good, but nothing compared to the curry chicken.

Don't forget, it's CASH ONLY! There are ATM's on both sides of the street.
author: Lauren C.

description: I give this place a three because I love their pho it's the next best thing from home. But the staff are extremely rude on the phone and when you eat there the place is super super filthy so I only get it to go. The three star for food and 0 star for decor and staff.
author: Michele T.

description: I'm crazy about spicy food, so if there is an option to make my food spicy even just for a little bit, I would. I have only tried the satay beef pho here, but I keep coming back for it. It's SO good!!! It's slightly spicy. The beef, tomato and the peanut sauce? give the broth a slightly thick consistency and it's very flavorful. Unlike just the regular beef pho with the clear broth, there is a lot going on in the broth. So if you are not a fan of that, don't order it. I think it tastes so good with the ho fun noodle! However, the place is a little bit understaffed though, so the wait is a bit long sometimes. They have forgotten to bring me a water/tea a couple times but they are just too busy. I'll still come back again though!
author: Siian X.

description:
I don't know what everyone's complaining about (customer-service-wise) -- the server who took my order was totally accommodating, and was sure to say goodbye and thank you to me on my way out.

I came in at 8:30pm on a Wednesday night to place an order for two large chicken noodle pho soups and fresh pork spring rolls to go, and it took them only 10 minutes or so to prepare it all! How fast! They're cash only, but there's a Wells Fargo right across the street. :) The total came out to about $23-something.

I LOVE the pho here. A friend of mine brought me the chicken noodle recently while I was sick, and I am just in love with how tender the chicken is! And the broth is so yummy, and the wide noodles they use for the pho reminds me of wonton soup. Sooo gooood.

It's just so inexpensive and delicious! I will definitely be back. :) And I'm excited to bring my friends here too.
author: Sherilynn M.

description:
Their chicken pho is really good; however, their service and attitude gives them the 1 star. Went here with a couple co workers one day and we had a lot of people - 9. So we split up and sat at different tables since there wasn't enough tables for us. We ate our food and when it came time for the check to come, the tip was already included. We were really confused since we only had like 5 ppl at our table and tip is only included in the bill if it's 6 or more. So my friend asks the waiter and he's like "oh you guys have 9 people". And we're like...but we sat at different tables and have separate checks....he just rudely brushed it off and was like "it doesn't matter" and walked away. So we were like ok let's just pay it, I guess next time we'll know. 

Then, what really confused me was that when my coworker from the other table asked why the tip was included in our table and not theirs, the older waitress got very angry and defensive. My coworker was not even being rude, she was literally being curious. So, the waitress was like "because they didn't pay tip last time!" (We so paid tip by the way...) first of all, the "last time" she is referring to was like 1-2 months ago...how the heck do you remember that. She even got furious and showed the receipt she saved from our last time there. Talk about holding grudges. I've never seen someone with such temperament to save someone's receipt from 2 months ago...never coming back. The whole thing just got me speechless. We did pay the tip and yet she is still bitter...it was just very petty and not professional at all.
author: Julie T.

description:
I like to come here for a quick yet satisfying pho craving!  My norm is their Bun Rieu.  I'm told there are better but there's limited pho places in the city that offers Bun Rieu on their menu, so I'm glad they have it here.  Their broth is tasty and not oily.  You get about 6 good size crab/meat balls, with tomatoes floating in the broth.  Served with a tray of shredded cabbage, limes, mint, cilantro and shrimp paste on the side.   It comes in either a small or large bowl.  I use to order the large but never finish it, now I order the small, which is just right.  Gets me satisfied but not stuffed.

I've also had their beef pho and it's good.  Mom and daughter usually order their chicken pho which they are known for.

They have a tofu purée drink that is very refreshing.  Served with shaved ice and a sweetened (very light) milk.  Must try!

Also had their beef carpaccio, chicken salad and imperial rolls.  All decent.  Never had a bad meal here.
author: The Q.

description: Very rude waitress but the food was good . She slammed the food on the table and was very snappy. The dishes were dirty.
author: Salome C.

description:
This has got to be my favorite restaurant of all time; it's fast, cheap and delicious. This is the abc's chicken noodle soup, filling the belly and the soul. I've literally dreamt about the pho while I was away from sf.

 I usually get the #7 (chicken pho) or #9 (rare beef steak pho. Occasionally ordering #6 (rare beef salad) if I have the luxury or feel the need to treat myself. 

Their #7 pairs nicely with their house made chili sauce, though I wouldn't recommend it to those who can't handle spicy. You've been warned... A dash of lime juice really brightens up the broth and brings out the sweetness of the broth.

As for the #9 I highly recommend ordering the steak on the side. It's an extra 50 cents but it's well worth it. Their steak is no ordinary steak you'd find in any typical pho restaurant. The steak they offer is extremely tender, cooking it in the broth would only make the meat tougher. But that's my preference; you do you.

Waiters and waitresses are alright, I mean you're dining in an Asian restaurant so you can't expect much. They're fast and efficient, so there's no complaints there. Unfortunately this restaurant is cash only. However there are several banks around. But if you're like me and your bank isn't around, there's a Safeway around 2 blocks away that does cash back!

A quick note to make: don't come here towards closing time. There's a high chance that they've ran out of a particular broth. You're probably going to end up with a limited selection of noodle soups. So unless you're not down to pho, you've miss your chance.
author: Dexter W.

description: The food here is good. But too much MSG... me and my dad was hella thirsty the whole day after we ate here. Hopefully the owner will put less MSG on the food. Then we may consider coming back
author: Sara K.

description:
good food, their pho is a different style that you might find from other places.

crap service, if you wanna experience the worse service this is the place. I know I shouldn't be looking for service in this kind of place, but they pissed me off.
author: Zack Y.

description:
When we approached the restaurant, it was packed and I envisioned waiting forever for a table. We were sat within five minutes of arrival. The service was friendly and very helpful. 

I had the pho with brisket and rare beef. It was delectable. The rice noodles were firm and the meat melted in my mouth. The broth was rich and flavorful. 

My guy had the chicken curry pho. He was very happy with it and dug into it like a champion. The chicken is chopped with bones in situ, so you do have to be a little careful when eating - but honestly, knowing him... I think that getting into it with his hands made him enjoy it more. It's a yellow curry/coconut based broth. Admittedly I did have a little food envy when his arrived -but I quickly got over it because mine was pretty delicious too. 

As a heads up - we got there a little after 7 on a Saturday night and they were already out of the oxtail pho (w/ red wine). We'd like to give this a go and will make sure to get there a little earlier next time. 

We have already raved about this place to all our outer sunset friends, we think this is a find and we'll be back.
author: Samara Z.

description:
I usually come here on cold and rainy days to enjoy a big bowl of their Pho Ga (chicken noodle soup). Overall though, this place is just alright... Let me explain: 

The good things about this place is that the pho is cheap and it's pretty good. Instead of the thin noodles pho is known for, they use thick noodles, which I actually prefer. The pho comes out relatively quick and hot. The soup is filled with the right amount of flavor and it doesn't taste like there's any MSG in the broth, which is a plus.

The bad things about this place are that it's not always consistent in quality and the service isn't always good. There are days (not often) when the broth is a little bland. The servers aren't always the friendliest and they always tend to "forget" things we ask for. Another downside is that besides the Pho Ga, nothing else really stands out on the menu.
author: Derek T.

description: This is my fav pho shop in SF! I recommend the chicken pho. The meat is always tender and the soup tastes clean and fresh. However make sure you bring cash!
author: Mick S.

description:
What's open on Christmas day?
Answer: this place

I ordered a coconut water and their ox tail noodle soup.

$15.00

The ox tail was hard and could have used several more hours to be tender, though the soup was flavorful with the green onions and white onions in the broth.

The coconut juice was a horrible watered down mixture.

There are better noodle places out there for sure, I was just looking for something quick since I'm a horrible cook.
author: Jack R.

description: I love Hanoi style pho so I frequent Turtle Tower (the locations on Geary or Larkin are better than the one in SOMA).
