description: I absolutely love this place and their pho. Currently daydreaming about eating there while I am at work... Have yet to try their other items before I give it 5 stars though :)
author: C. C.

description: A-yo, I'm from SJ bro, so I know what is good pho....I do prefer the southern style a bit more cuz of the fresh veggies but if I'm in the mood for some viet-cong style food, this is the place to go dude....get the chicken pho...and not the beef...cuz chickens are more peaceful...
author: niwath c.

description: I had an absolutely terrible experience today at this restaurant. Not only did the owner roll his eyes when we asked for water, we also were served some sort of mystery meat in our rare beef #9 pho. I've been coming to this place religiously (1-2x/week) and despite the service being terrible, I've been addicted to the Pho. However, after this incident, I will no longer be coming to this place EVER AGAIN. I have no idea what they used in the pho today, but the meat was abnormally dark red and it never actually finished cooking. This place is a heath hazard.
author: Dorian C.

description:
I really like this place for their soups, cheap and simple menu!  

When my husband & I come here, we always order the same soups and vietnamese coffee all just under $20 + $3 for tip! 

* Chicken noodle soup - the soup is tasty, yet so simple. not a bunch of stuff in it! you have to see & try it so you'll know exactly what i'm talking about. the chicken every time tastes so fresh! don't know any other place that serves it like this.

* Tomato egg/crab soup -  no other place that serves it like this either! this is the one that i order. i don't even add any of the extra stuff that comes on the side (e.g. cabbage, cilantro, etc.). well, maybe just a little bit of the salted shrimp paste for some balance, but that's it. oh, if you decide to have this, please remember when you leave, that your clothes WILL smell!!! so, only have this if you're going home straight after.

Service is great overall. The servers there are nice and attentive. The tables are always clean. And they play cool songs. 

My dislikes: 
* rice plates - I've tried it a couple of times and didn't care for it. Don't even bother. The restaurants now don't make it as good, nor do they give as much as they used to back in the day. 
* cash only
* always cold in there
* not so easy parking
* one restroom - not well kept as it was when they first opened. it smells now and on one occasion, there was no handsoap :( minus 1 star! 

Try this place out and make sure you Yelp it! They deserve some more reviews!
author: Jennifer C.

description: Decent pho but the service was brusque and the place is pretty dirty.  Cash only and if it's crowded and there's room at your table, you may be asked to share.  Surprisingly, parking was easy to find.
author: Toni C.

description:
Originally planned to go to another restaurant, but because it was crowded, I ended up going to this restaurant which required no wait and was quiet enough for chatting.  We ended up staying for a while and were not rushed to leave.

After contemplating over what to order, I finally decided on the crab  tomato noodle soup but they were sold out.  So instead, I ended up choose the curry chicken noodle soup.  The broth was thick and very tasty.  In fact, it turns out that I ended up finishing all the broth and still had noodles and chicken left.  The chicken was ok, and all the pieces had lots of bones.  The portions are huge.  I ordered a small bowl, but it seemed more like a large bowl.  

I would go back again if I am in the area and still would like to try the crab tomato noodle soup.
author: S Y.

description: Man... I just don't know what to say.  Rare beef pho was awesome.  The beef was actually rare.  Can you believe it? Broth was well flavored.  Best pho I have had in the city.
author: don c.

description: 4 stars for the service, but an extra star for the chicken pho! It's really good there!
author: Valerie T.

description:
Not good. 

I ordered Chicken Pho and got a bowl of chicken hearts. 

I was too scared to tell them that was not what I wanted. For fear of what might show up next. 

Next time I went because Tay Giang was too busy. 
I got a bowl of hot water with some noodles in it. 

Spare yourself and go two doors down to a better restaurant or go to Safeway for Ramen.
author: forrest l.

description: i love five spiced chicken, this place makes delicious five spiced chicken, therefore i love this place! they fry their chicken thighs with the skin on, resulting in a very crispy, full flavored outer crust. the meat is tender and perfectly cooked. over a bed of vermicelli and it's an amazing meal. this place rivals the five spiced chicken of ppq on irving, which i thought made the best chicken in sf. now i've found an equal, minus a long wait, which means its got the slight upper hand...this place has now become my go-to chicken joint.
author: Melissa Y.

description: NORTHERN VIETNAMESE FOOD. SO GOOD. it reminds me of turtle tower but BETTER. its not as salty. this place is delicious. everything i ordered was legit. I crave it everyday.. I go at least once a week now. LOL
author: Cindy L.

description:
Customer service sucks ass here.

Twenty minutes before closing, my friend and I walk in & sit down to grab a quick bite.

The staff immediately began talking in chinese to each other (assuming we didn't understand) 

Staff #1: I told you to turn off the lights.
Staff #2: How was I suppose to know customers would be walking in?
Staff #1: Damn, I told you to do it earlier.

Man, way to make your customers feel welcome. Granted that it was near closing, under no circumstances should this type of service be allowed. Just plain rude. Food was average. Noodles were on the overcooked, soft side. I'd take Turtle Tower over this place any day!!!
author: Alice T.

description: Had the rare steak and beef ball pho..the soup was good..the noodles were the small wide verson..I like the steak, but the beef ball was a hard.. overall, I'll come back if I'm in the neighborhood and feeling for pho.. but, next time, based on other yelp reviews, I gotta try the chicken pho
author: Linda Y.

description:
Northern Vietnamese pho...

one of the main reasons i love vietnamese food is simply because it's cheap .. but this place was somewhat pricey ... but guess it was worth it because it was super clean (the soup) and yummy... 

i'm sure others can agree and follow that other reasons why they appreciate vietnamese food and again, it's because it's quick... less than 5 mins to wait ... can't beat that!

after ordering our small order ($5.75) of pho, i started getting thirsty ... i asked one of the servers (POLITELY) if i could have water, and stupid me asked him as he was doing god knows what under the table... i figured he didn't hear me, so i asked again, after he got out ... "can i have ice water please?" 

-----

then, he snapped back w/ an attitude, "I KNOW!" like, loud enough for the whole street of noriega to hear him. 

JESUS...

WO WO WO !!! calm down buddy, chill out ... relax ... breathe in, breathe out... how was i supposed to know you heard me ... 

from past experiences whenever i ask ANY MALE SPECIE something when they are focused with one thing, so be it their sports games or what not, they zone out ... and get into a different zone ... 

i repeat, men can't multi task ... TRUST ME!

GOODNESS...

minus that, and minus the pricey $6 3 piece egg rolls, must say, it was probably one of the best pho joints... $6! come on! for 3 pieces! and they lacked all the lettuce!!! whatevers ... but still ...  that doesn't give him any right for him to feel all PMS-Y... :(
author: Jennifer S.

description: Absolutely, one of the BEST pho ga (chicken noodle) places in San Francisco. It's Northern Vietnamese style so the noodles are slightly bigger than the regular thin pho noodles. Fast and delicious, what more can you ask for? You come in, sit down and order REG sized #4. In less than five minutes, you'll have a piping hot bowl of sweet chicken soup with soft noodles and yummy chicken, all topped off with a nice helping of onions, cilantro, and scallions. (You can ask for no onions) Their satay beef noodle is pretty good too. Definitely, definitely come and try their pho ga, which is pretty much what they're known for.
author: Jenny Y.

description: I recently dined at this restaurant and ordered something that I wasn't sure I was going to like: Crab meat with tomato and onion  pho. I know, it doesn't sound appealing, but it actually tasted alright. The tomatoes and onions in my soup actually gave it a different flavor that I wasn't used to in pho. The naive side of me was expecting real crab meat, but the crab meat was more like a crab-meatball (it was like ground artificial crab meat). Whatever. Most pho places will give you bean sprouts with cilantro on the side, but this place gave cabbage which was nice for a change. I once ordered chicken noodle soup here too and that tasted good, so I haven't had a bad experience at this place which is a good thing. I like this place and so should you.
author: Kimberly H.

description: everyone says how good their food is, yes, that may be partly true, how i feel is that service must be just as good! for some strange reason these people, all of the staff as i noticed there are 2 shifts, both suck. how long have they been in the US, do they even know what manners are? do they not have manners in vietnam, or are they beyond us people here in the US. i won't go back there, the midget that works the lunch hour thinks he's so mighty, complained to him that last time they foregot to include peppers & he got all huffy about no they didn't & look peppers are in the baggie. LOOK WE PUT YOU ON THE MAP. SMILE ONCE IN AWHILE, YOUR FACE WON'T BREAK! STILL REFUSE TO GO THERE ANYMORE........ TONS OF PHO CAFE'S ALL OVER THE sf AREA WHICH ARE BETTER THAN THEY ARE. SAME GOES  WITH KEVIN'S & PPQ. LOSERS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: david c.

description: The pho is decent. Lately I've been addicted to chicken noodle soup after having it at Turtle Tower in the TL. I get it everywhere I go now because I'm addicted, but Pho Quan Ngon's chicken noodle soup is OK at best... it might just be me. I like flat noodle pho, but something just wasn't right... I've been here a few times, always expecting things to turn around, but it always stay the same. Oh right... nobody filled up my empty cup of tea. I hate it when that happens, but what do you expect?
author: Edgar G.

description: This is the best pho in the city!  I don't know what these fools are talking about..  This place has fresh thick noodles, tasty, hot, clean broth, and quality meat.  This is traditional Northern style pho so you don't get bean sprouts and basil with it, just lime and chilies.  authentic - that's why.  The other reviewers must be addicted to MSG or prefer super fatty broth.  If you want to try the real stuff, go here and wait in line, its worth it.  Also try the Bun Rieu (tomato crab noodle soup) when you're feeling adventurous, its the best one i've had at a restaurant.
author: Dawn P.

description: Good Northern Vietnamese style pho.  The place is pretty clean.  Cleaner than most Vietnamese restaurants.  Staff is not that friendly and the service isn't great but they are efficient.  They play wild 94.9 loudly in the back and it's annoying.  Not what I want to be listening to while I eat my meal.
author: Stacey L.

description: excellent beef broth. but pho without bean sprouts and Basil is kinda odd.   also need more lettuce to wrap the imperial rolls in.
author: michael d.

description: I would consider this place to be the ultimate for pho.  I have yet to find another place which could even compare in taste (with, of course, the exception of its sister restaurant in the Richmond).  The crab balls with tomato pho I could probably live off of everyday if need be.  The service is not the best, but not too horrible either, which would generally render a lost star if it were not for their delicious crab balls!
author: Violet S.

description:
Went to this place based on oreading the other yelp reviews.  It was clean, found free parking easily,  and went after the lunch rush on a weekday.  Every table was still occupied when we got there- a good sign.    We ordered the big bowl of Pho Ga - chicken noodle soup and the #35 (?)  Vermicelli with bbq pork and imperial rolls.  The waiters were efficient and we received the food within six or seven minutes.    With my first bite of #35 - the freshness of the bean sprouts and slivers of carrots, cucumbers and mint impressed  my happy noodle filled mouth.   I dipped my imperial roll in the fish sauce and smiled as I crunched through the roll.  However, the bbq pork did not meet the five star qualiity of the rest of this dish.   I was expecting another flavor explosion, but my taste buds just said "the pork is  ok."     
As for the Pho Ga,  .it was a five star dish -   The soup base was made from a delicious chicken stock.  Numerous pieces of velvety chicken with skin attached  swam in the broth.  The noodles, were thin rice noodles.  They were delicate, freshly made, and very slurpable.    Green onions and cilantro had also been generously added.  A great dish for a cold San Francisco summer day.in the Sunset.    My four star rating is really 41/2 stars.   slurp on
author: Wilfred L.

description: This was the location that introduced me to Pho with flat rice noodle aka. Northern Style and I fell in love with it. Granted I first started eating at this location at least 2 years ago and I believe there has been management change, but I still find myself coming back for the Pho Ga (Chicken Pho). Why you may ask? It is because of the fact that I can enjoy my meal without the usual mound of bean sprouts, basil leaves, and mixture of sriracha or hoisin sauce. I have tried their Pho Bo Dac Biet (Meat Special), but was disappointed when they switch to those packaged type beef balls from their usual larger ones. The Pho Ga is usually prepared well with flavorful broth and decent chunks of juicy chicken. I do recommend this spot to those willing to try something different than their traditional Pho spots. I have been coming back to this spot on occasion, and I don't see myself stopping anytime soon.
author: Casey L.

description: The noodle place that we wanted to go to up the block was closed so we came here on a whim.  And I'm glad we did.  I ordered the Bun Rieu.  The broth is just like how my parents make it.  Nice thin broth with just enough crab paste and tomato goodness.  Will come back again.
author: Jeanne L.

description: Sunset's answer to Northern Vietnamese pho. The broth is clean, rich, and nuclear hot, just the way I like it.  The rare beef is quality meat and cut thinly. Their meatballs are gigantic.  My friend swears by their beef stew, but it's just okay in my book. Their bun rieu was fair also. I usually stick with the beef noodle soup combos. I know what I'm there for and I won't deviate.  Their portions are huge. I think their smalls are other people's larges-fyi. Also note, they sometimes blast their music, so this place should not be an option if you have a hangover and you're trying to heal yourself with pho (learned the hard way).
author: Ezduzit S.

description: the bun thang was pretty good. broth was light and flavorful. it could have used more egg, gio, and chicken. but overall very satisfying.
author: Linda N.

description: pretty good, better than turtle tower's service FOR SURE. i will be back!
author: Q W.

description:
So arriving at this place, the taste is familiar since i have come here occasionally. i came with three other friends that never tried this restaurant . The parking is convenient since we parked right front and were able to eat asap since we were all very hungry.

I would say not best pho around, but cheap and edible. good for lunches and good for quick bites. Definitely a friends & family spot.. Lastly, not an authentic Vietnamese restaurant because its owned by Chinese people!

Trust.
author: Serena J.

description: Uhhhhhh, sooooooooo disappointed! I came here based on the reviews and on the fact that I LOVE pho and the best I've ever had was in sf. I'm a vegetarian so naturally I ordered the veggie pho. I thought it was strange that he asked if I wanted chicken broth for my veggie pho, but I said no, and asked for veggie broth. When the soup arrived I was surprised that the soup didn't come with ANY of my fav stuff... No broccoli, no carrots, no nothing except..... Wait, are those tomatoes? Wierd, ok, whatever, I can handle it. Still waiting on my fav part of pho, the basil and sproutS.... What!!!??? No basil? They don't even have it in house. The tofu was raw.. Looked like they cut it out of the package and threw it in the bowl along the with the noodles and tomatoes.. Sigh. On the plus the broth was really good... Almost too good. Lol. Hope they didn't slip in chicken broth... Guess I'll know soon enough. Oh, one final word. The guy from the kitchen came out for a family dinner wearing his glove through his whole meal, an then went backto work. Gross. I like hole in the wall places, but I like to pretend that they actually change their gloves once in a while. Ugh. Bummer. Won't be back.
author: Kelly F.

description: i actually like their pho. service is okay and keep in mind they take cash only.
author: Valerie N.

description: Service is fast and efficient. The chicken noodle is very good here. They use free-range chicken and their soup doesn't contain any MSG (asked the owner)! I'd rather go somewhere where the soup won't leave my mouth dry with too much MSG. The ice drink with sweet tofu is great (even though it sounds  a little weird, it's rather refreshing).
author: L C.

description: This place is quiet and the food is great. I'm not really used to thick noodles in my Pho, but it turned out quite nice even w/o sprouts. Cheap and tasty!
author: Vince V.

description: I'm not a big Vietnamese food fan, but this place is decent and cheap.  I would've given this place 3 stars if they served their noodles with sprouts and basil.  I asked for it the first time I was there, the waiter looked at me as if I was asking for his first born and denied me like the Soup Nazi of Seinfeld.
author: Brian H.

description: Like one other reviewer, I also found a hair in my chicken pho after I had eaten it. I was really disgusted but asked for another bowl of noodles. I actually lost my appetite after that and didn't eat much. I should have just asked them to take it off the check. Before the hair incident, I absolutely LOVED the chicken noodles here. It's going to take me a while to forget about the hair incident so I guess I won't be back until then.
author: Al T.

description: The food was so so. I prefer the pho restaurants on Irving and 19th. Also, if you're Caucasian you will get preferred/VIP service here.  Just an observation.
author: Roland V.

description: The noodle soup is decent and the service is pretty fast.  There are always large crowds at lunch so there can be a wait.  There is almost no one there for dinner.  I have also tried the ox tail which is ok.
author: Ginny M.

description:
this place is a bit different than other pho places. their noodles and wider but less chewy than most pho noodles. the noodles don't come with bean sprouts and basil/cilantro like most pho places (the waiter informs me that thats northern style?) but their pho is really good. i like to order the pho with rare steak or their vermicilli. their soup doesn't make you thirsty like a lot of pho places that add lots of MSG. if you don't feel like noodles, theyre beef stew is really good.

small place and gets crowded on weekends.
author: Douglas F.

description: This place has similar pho like 'Turtle Tower in the Tenderloin' but it taste much worst.  They have decent tomato broth noodles soup (bun rieu).
author: Lily K.

description:
somehow during biology lab we went from talking about plant reproduction to sharing stories of travels to vietnam, then started naming all our favorite vietnamese foods. 

so after class we just had to get some pho, and one of the guys said we have to go here for the best.

I went with the pho dac biet, large size!! 

big noodles, big meatballs, tender beef, thick hearty soup with lots of flavor = great bowl of pho

only weird thing was when we asked for bean sprouts, they said they dont serve that. we only got limes and jalepenos on the side.
author: David D.

description:
yummy food & like 3 cute waiters. they're really nice tooo.
you know how usually, you'd be like "thanks" when someone brings you something & they just look at you? yeeeaah, well these guys say "you're welcome"! idon'tknow, but that just makes me feel better cuz when people don't say anything it makes me feel like i wasted my breath. =P and then when i left, i forgot my phone on the table and this guy came out to give it to me =) how nice=D
author: Erica A.

description: Fast service. The pho wasn't anything special.
author: Katherine C.

description: not too bad for a not wanting to go all the way to Irving or Clement. the soup was flavorful but full of MSG... the meat was pretty tender tho, surprising for a Pho place. the spring rolls kinda sucked but i liked my bowl of pho. it hit the spot on a cold summer day...
author: Gordon L.

description: Very good pho tai.  They use the wide egg noodle, which is okay, but which I don't prefer, but more than make up for it with an excellent broth.  The soup is very rich and meaty and really sticks to the tongue.
author: Eric W.

description: This was my first taste of Northern Vietnamese pho. And...it made me want to stick with the usual kind. The broth was kind of bland and I really prefer the small rice noodles and the choice to add my bean sprouts and basil. We also ordered the fish cakes that the waitress recommended but they tasted more herby than fishy...which we didn't like that much either. I wouldn't come back.
author: Tiff L.

description: This place has good Pho! I like the noodles and the broth tastes good. Although this is not my favorite pho restaurant I will be coming here again because it is in my neighborhood.
author: Maria C.

description: I ordered the beef noodle soup (#10) and it was pretty good. The soup isn't heavy in taste like some other noodle places, but it still had flavor. It was pretty good.
author: Steve Y.

description: So I went to their location on Clement Street to try out the pho there.  Boy was I upset.  I found a long strand of hair in my pho. SO GROSS!!!! I mention this to the server and he asked if I would like something else.  Because I was with my friend and he just got his food I did not want to make a big deal.  The server offered to bring me another bowl of pho.  When the second bowl came I fished around and saw ANOTHER piece of hair in the pho.  I would not recommend this or any of the other location to anyone unless you want to eat something that is disgustingly.
author: Beau S.

description:
one of my favorite pho place!
like: soup is not very greasy w/ a hint of ginger, beef is TENDER, noodle is not the usual pho, but the softer rice noodle 
dislike: no bean sprouts :(
author: Jen C.

description: First of all, I grew up on my mom's cooking.  She made the BEST pho, bun rieu, cha gio. You name it, she made it. All my aunties agreed that hers was the best. Now that my mom is not with us, I either have to cook it myself or find a close second. That being said, this place is great when I don't feel like cooking.  My husband and I tried this place last week and I held up a cha gio (imperial roll) and told him I'm glad I know how to make this, but damn it's close. I have not ordered the pho yet, but will next week when we go back.  I ordered the bun rieu (noodle soup with crab and tomato) and my husband ordered the oxtail stew in wine sauce. I just want to say that it is rare to get a clean, clear  broth that tastes this good.  I noticed that the first time i ordered this soup. My soup was served with mint, cabbage, chilies and lime, with a side of shrimp paste. It was all good.  My husband's meal came with rice and french bread for dipping. The cha gio came with lettuce, noodles, some pickled carrots, and nouc mam for wrapping and dipping.  But the thing that made my meal great was that when i ordered it in Vietnamese, our waitress not realizing I spoke, started talking to me in Vietnamese.  I haven't spoken my mother tongue in years and it felt good.  I think my husband was impressed as he has never heard me speak it.  I even ordered his meal for him. Ooooo now he knows I'm a cunning linguist.  We have been here twice, and will be coming back for sure.  The wait staff work together and always greet you and bid you good bye.  The food is not fancy, but it's not supposed to be. Oh yeah, there's DDR rave music playing in the background.  It's not loud or anything, just worthy of noting...
author: kim s.

description: service is fast and efficient but the staff is not really  friendly.  the food is just ok and the menu is really small.
author: L C.

description: They just opened a new restaurant on clement and 8th. I am so excited to have the added variation that this new location offers. The garlic noodles with bbq pork is a nice change and absolutely delicious. I frequently eat at the noriega location but the new location is even closer and offers a bigger eating environment so less wait for me. Even better!!!
author: Lyo K.

description: i have been eating here for about 4 years now, and i always order chicken pho. this place never disappoints me. i like it way better than Turtle Tower, simply because they used better chicken. and i also love their hot sauce, to me Hot sauce is very important for any restaurant that sells noodle soup. and turtle tower only had cock sauce and i hate cock sauce because it taste like sweet and sour sauce to me. to all the people that like HOT stuff, go to this place and try their chicken pho with their homemade hot sauce!!
author: Jackson W.

description: I ordered the five spice chicken rice plate. They gave so much rice! but the chicken wasnt as good as it is at PPQ.
author: Retired B.

description: This place rocks...from the chicken noodle soup, to the imperial rolls to the hungover waiters pumping hip hop in the kitchen...if you like Turtle Tower soup, you will like this place; maybe eve better. Parking can be a pain in the ass, but think positive and visualize a space!. Also place is kinda small, I would say 10 tables?
author: Steve K.

description: I went to this place today to eat but my boy mike q wasnt here. where you go mike. this place was fun but now its boring ass hell
author: j W.

description: came here today for rice and chicken... the plate that i ordered wasn't that good.. maybe i should have stuck with a noodle bowl cuz the bowl of noodles that my bf ordered looked really good. it had BIG meatballs and this meat thing. even though he likes southern viet noodle dishes more, he said that the one he ordered may be one of his favorites. it was pretty cheap too. about $14 for two entrees and the service is really fast. waited less than 5 mins before the dishes arrived=)
author: christy w.

description: man, this place has some delicious chicken noodle soup for those rainy days, or for those people under the weather!  I usually order the #4 with extra chicken...
author: C C.

description: Pho is so-so.  Service is terrible.  I've been to many pho places before, so this isn't anything special.  If you want something quick, this is the place.  The last time we went there for dinner, our waiter was not very friendly when we asked for two boxes.  He didn't even bother looking when he dropped the boxes on the table.  I thanked him loudly and he doesn't even bother to acknowledge it.
author: Gina R.

description: i like these noodles as opposed to the other pho noodles people are use to. the other noodles get soggy while these dont. i always come here for the chicken pho and they always make it super fast when i get it to go.
author: Bobby J.

description: i went to pho quan ngon yesterday morning i order chicken noodle soup and beef soup are  very good  and they serve very nice.
author: Bob L.
